summary: This code imports TensorFlow and nsfwjs libraries, processes GIF frames at 1fps, loads a model for classification using predictions, and sets up a file stream to read data in chunks for partial processing.

details.comment: Code imports TensorFlow and nsfwjs libraries, and defines an array of prediction results for three frames. The filepath is set to "/root/Desktop/works/pyjom/samples/video/kitty_flash_15fps.gif". The code chooses the top three categories from each frame, processes them at 1fps, and does not consider other classes.

The code reads a file into a stream, stores it in chunks, combines the chunks into a final data buffer, and then loads a model to classify the GIF using its predictions. This allows for efficient processing of large files and accurate detection of content.

This code snippet sets up a file stream that reads data in chunks. The 'data' event triggers for each chunk, and pushes the chunk into an array (chunks). This allows performing actions on partial data as it arrives.
